name: Crowne Plaza Adelaide

reviews.text: When We arrived at the Crowne Plaza in Adelaide we where greeted by friendly staff who parked the car although exepnsive it was very good service. We checked in without a problem this was very good and they aknowledged that i was a prority club member and was asked it I wanted a complimentary news paper in the morning to which i said yes. We went to the room which was very clean and tidy and looked inviting. My sister and I really thought it was a five star hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it was very confortable place to stay.
reviews.title: Adelaide Trip

reviews.text: For some reason I had booked my colleagues into the Crown Plaza and myself into The Intercontinental, both in Adelaide. On arrival the receptionist, Heather, quickly resolved my mistake, found room for me in the Crown Plaza thereby keeping the party together. Her service and attention were excellent. We found the rooms and room service, including meals, to be "spot on". The valet parking team in what is a fairly tight forecourt were outstanding. The Redsalt restaurant was a "cut above" with the staff displaying both style and a good knowledge of both the food and wines on offer. I would not hesitate to stay here again - in fact we are in May!
reviews.title: Exemplary service in a modern four star city centre hotel

reviews.text: Good location but difficult to find parking on arrival - resorted to valet parking - pricey but convenient. The check-in process itself was friendly but no real recognition of my priority club status.
reviews.title: Comfortable room, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby was very nice and spacious and fitted out well, with stone or marble being dominant. The room had a king bed opposite the lifts and looking out onto a roof with air conditioning fans - not a drama unless you looked out - but the room was sufficiently sound proofed not to notice them. The room was slightly small but about average in terms of its quality but it looked comfortable which was the main thing. Our room was clean. The bathroom was slightly small but otherwise quite nicely prese
reviews.title: Excellent
nice hotel with good location
reviews.text: Not much to say about the Crowne Plaza in Adelaide other than it is an excellent hotel that gets just about everything right. The welcome was friendly and the receptionist went to great length to find a room we could check into early.
Great location right in the heart of the city. Spotless hotel. Staff that are polite, professional and courteous. Rooms are really nice.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Would definately stay there next time I'm in Adelaide with the missus.
reviews.title: Great hotel would stay again

reviews.text: We stayed over Easter for a few days, and this hotel was an absolutely wonderful experience! So close to the main hub of Rundell Mall, and a $20 taxi ride from the domestic airport. Our room was clean, tidy and larger than usual hotels we have stayed at. It had two double beds,that were soft but comfortable. A large bathroom, huge bathtub, gigantic shower, mini bar, bathrobes and a balcony overlooking parts of Adelaide. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful, even at 4.30am when we checked out to head back home. We also requested extra towels, that arrived within two minutes of our phone call! A flat screen TV is centrally located on the wall, internet available and it was more than adequate for our four night stay. The security for the hotel was fantastic, with access to the hotel available only with a room key. A great idea, and a real sense of security! The valet staff (valet costs around $35) were always very helpful, polite and friendly and every morning had our car ready for us to explore the rest of Adelaide. The whole hotel stay went without a hitch!
reviews.title: Loved the Crowne Plaza in Adelaide - will definitely stay there next time I go to Adelaide.

reviews.text: The only complaint we had on our stay, was the buffet breakfast served at the hotel. Such an amazing array to choose from, but the full "hot" breakfast was cold! So we chose to eat elsewhere, as brekky cost us $90 ($30 per head), but being so close to the busy malls of Adelaide, we found numerous places to dine.
reviews.title: Good rooms but A bit dissapointed on services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we return to this pretty city, we will be staying at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, nice location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights very friendly staff and helpfull good location very modern and clean rooms very comfortable you can even chose your own pillow. I had a balcony room great view. Room service great they could not do enough for you well done Crown Plaza
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, great staff, so happy and welcoming. We arrived late and went up to the room. It was fantastic, on the 13th floor so had a beautiful view.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: The room had a lovely king size bed and huge bath. The set up of the room was great too as was the option to choose your own pillow!
reviews.title: The best hotel for Business or holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast down stairs and while it was expensive ($30 for full breakfast) it was enjoyable. The food was fresh and lots of options. The coffee was great too :-) All up a fantastic stay. We got a deal through Wotif which made the stay cheap too.
reviews.title: friendly

reviews.text: This hotel has it all. Location, Service, Food, Service and atmosphere.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be frank the room and the hotel itself wasn't too bad. It had been recently refurbished and was relatively quiet (even though it overlooked a car park!) What was really terrible was the service. For what is claimed to be a 5 star hotel it was rubbish! It started with booking the car into the valet parking, it seemed to be a big problem for these guys. Then they wouldn't recommend somewhere to go for breakfast prior to us checking in. Later on we realised we had misplaced our expensive digital SLR camera it was too much trouble for the staff to help us try to locate it. Then to top it off someone tried to access our room at 6am! So would I stay here again? No
reviews.title: I wouldn't go back

reviews.text: The hotel is very modern and clean. We stayed here with a group of 8 friends. The beds are super comfy and pillows superb. Our only complaint is check-in was at 2p.m, we arrived at 3:30. Two of our rooms were not cleaned yet and we were not given our keys until 5 p.m. We were dying for a coffee and not enough cups in one room for us all so they gave us free lattes. Apart from that the spa and pool are nice. Love the furniture in the hotel, well thought out. Overall great stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in great location.

reviews.text: Crown Plaza Adelaide is a great, no fuss and easy to use hotel. The facilities are great and the rates are much cheaper than comparable hotels in Melbourne or Sydney. Very centrally located. This is something common to all 4 or 5 star hotels, but the wireless internet is too expensive when on a long stay here.
reviews.title: Great business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza adelaide on our wedding night. After checking quite late, we were very pleased with the size and the decor of our room. We stayed in the corner balcony suite and the view at night & day were very nice. The bed also was very comftorble. The only downfall was trying to order from room service, they found it very hard to understand me for some reason and called back to confirm our breakfast order. They seemed to be still confused when the breakfast arrived as they said they were not sure what kind of eggs we wanted so they gave us all. This resulted in a bill for breakfast of $62 which I was not too pleased about. Otherwise a nice, comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Nice, modern hotel in the centre of Adelaide

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In April 2011 my wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days. At checkout, I booked two tickets for the airport coach due to depart at 1pm and waited in the foyer. After 1 and a half hours and when the time had reached 1:15pm, I enquired at the desk on where the coach was and was informed that it had already left. No one from the hotel ever told us that the coach had arrived or was waiting for its passengers.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service

description: Surrounded by the peaceful gardens of Hindmarsh Square and with many of the city’s most popular cafes and restaurants right at our doorstep, Crowne Plaza Adelaide is the accommodation of choice for those seeking a truly connected and memorable Adelaide experience. Each of our 308 modern rooms have been designed with our guests’ optimum comfort in mind. Each room comes equipped with deluxe amenities, including ergonomic workstations and luxurious bedding to ensure you are well rested during your holiday or business stay. Those visiting Adelaide on business may enjoy the use of our 24-hour guest business centre, or perhaps take advantage of our renowned Meeting Success program, featuring the one-to-one attention of a dedicated Crowne Plaza Meetings Director. Guests seeking to remain active while they travel may also enjoy the use of our on-site gymnasium, pool, spa and sauna facilities. If you're looking to explore the city, our Concierge will assist in securing all the information you’ll need to take a tour of the local wineries, visit the world-renowned giant pandas at Adelaide Zoo, or explore the sandy beaches at nearby Glenelg. Crowne Plaza Adelaide has been awarded Australia's Top Tourism Development in the 2012 Property Council of Australia Innovation & Excellence Awards as was the winner of the the AAA Tourism Best Deluxe Accommodation Award for 2011. Discover South Australia and celebrate your stay at Crowne Plaza Adelaide.
